concept.title: Authentication in
concept.shortdesc: supports more than one type of authentication. But, it is recommended you use OAuth2.0 framework using OpenID for authentication.

conbody.p: supports the following types of authentication:

li.p: Authentication using JWT on the API Gateway and an external Identity provider for both OpenID and SAML.

conbody.p: It is recommended you use OAuth2.0 framework using OpenID for authentication, leveraging JWT on the API gateway. But, if you are looking for that quick prototyping or internal API use-case, you can use the Basic Authentication (username/password) by using the Gateway. With the Gateway you can authenticate an API execution along with the Developer Portal sign-in.
The following types of authentication are soon to be retired and hence not recommended:

li.p: Use of an external identity provider with a Broker to implement OpenID and SAML.

conbody.note: Unless you already have a Broker installed, it is no longer possible to install or reinstall a Broker. The Broker is set to be retired in the July 2022 time frame and it is recommended that you use JWT or Basic Authentication (Gateway).
